about.title: About M3ak
about.subtitle: Compassionate Mental Health Support for All
about.missionStatement: M3ak is dedicated to providing accessible, compassionate mental health support to everyone. We believe that seeking help is a sign of strength, and no one should face their struggles alone.
about.value1Desc: Every individual deserves respect, dignity, and non-judgmental support
about.value2Desc: Our team comprises licensed, experienced psychologists and counselors
about.value3Desc: We honor and respect diverse backgrounds and experiences
about.value4Desc: Mental health support should be available to everyone
about.value5Desc: We prioritize immediate support during critical moments
about.value6Desc: We provide ongoing care for sustainable mental health improvement
about.whyMattersText: Mental health is just as important as physical health. Millions of people worldwide face mental health challenges, and with proper support, recovery and healing are possible.
about.whyMattersBullet1: 1 in 4 people will experience mental health issues
about.whyMattersBullet2: Mental health affects every aspect of life
about.whyMattersBullet3: Early intervention leads to better outcomes
about.whyMattersBullet4: Seeking help is a sign of strength
about.howWeApproach: How We Approach Mental Health Support
about.approach1Desc: We start with a thorough evaluation to understand your unique needs and circumstances.
about.approach2Desc: We develop customized strategies tailored to your specific situation and goals.
about.approach3Desc: We use proven therapeutic approaches backed by scientific research.
about.approach4Desc: We provide continuous care and monitoring throughout your healing journey.
about.approach5Desc: Immediate support and guidance during critical moments.
about.approach6Desc: We address all aspects of wellbeing, including physical, emotional, and social factors.
about.importantNoticeText: This service is not a substitute for emergency medical care.
about.importantNoticeSecond: If you are in immediate danger, please contact emergency services immediately.
about.readyToStartText: Take the first step towards better mental health today.

resources.subtitle: Knowledge and tools to support your mental health journey
resources.inCrisis: If You're in Crisis Right Now
resources.crisisMessage: If you're having thoughts of suicide or in immediate danger:
resources.emergencyServiceDesc4: Go to nearest hospital for immediate care
resources.warningSignalsIntro: If you notice these signs in yourself or someone you care about, reach out for help immediately:
resources.behavioral2: Sudden changes in behavior or mood
resources.emotional5: Feeling trapped or in unbearable pain
resources.verbal5: Everyone would be better off without me
resources.situational1: Loss of a loved one or relationship
resources.situational4: History of mental illness or trauma
resources.whatToDo: What to Do If Someone is in Crisis
resources.step1Title: Stay Calm and Take It Seriously
resources.step1Desc: Never dismiss what they're saying. Listen without judgment and show you care about their wellbeing.
resources.step2Desc: Don't be afraid to ask 'Are you thinking about suicide?' This doesn't plant the idea – it opens communication.
resources.step3Desc: Let them express their feelings. Validate their emotions even if you don't understand their thoughts.
resources.step4Desc: Remove access to means of harm if possible (weapons, medication). Stay with them or ensure they're with a trusted person.
resources.step5Desc: Contact a mental health professional, call the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline, or go to an emergency room.
resources.copingPhysicalDesc: Exercise releases endorphins and reduces stress. Even a 20-minute walk can improve mood and mental clarity.
resources.copingMindfulnessDesc: Practice being present in the moment. Guided meditation apps can help reduce anxiety and racing thoughts.
resources.copingJournalingDesc: Writing down your feelings helps process emotions and identify patterns. No judgment – just honest expression.
resources.copingSocialDesc: Reach out to trusted friends or family. Connection is protective. Even a text to someone can help.
resources.copingSleepDesc: Prioritize sleep and eat regular, nutritious meals. Physical health directly impacts mental wellbeing.
resources.copingCreativeDesc: Art, music, writing, or any creative outlet helps process emotions in healthy ways.
resources.groundingIntro: When you're feeling overwhelmed or panicked, these techniques can help bring you back to the present moment:
resources.technique1Desc: This grounds you in the present moment and away from anxious thoughts.
resources.technique2Desc: Regulates your nervous system and reduces anxiety and panic.
resources.technique3Step1: Sit comfortably and close your eyes
resources.technique3Step2: Starting at your toes, notice any tension
resources.technique3Step3: Gradually move attention up your body
resources.technique3Desc: Releases physical tension and promotes relaxation and awareness.
resources.technique4Step1: Tense a muscle group for 5 seconds
resources.technique4Step3: Move to the next muscle group
resources.technique4Desc: Creates awareness of tension and promotes deep relaxation.

contact.title: Contact & Emergency Support
contact.subtitle: Multiple ways to reach us when you need help
contact.emergencyCall: Call 190 (SAMU) or go to your nearest Emergency Room immediately.
contact.emergencyDescription: This website provides psychological support but is not a substitute for emergency services.
contact.whatsappDesc: Chat when you can't talk on the phone
contact.formDescription: Have a question or need more information? Fill out the form below and we'll get back to you as soon as possible.
contact.thankYou: Thank you for reaching out. We'll respond as soon as possible.
contact.crisisPrompt: If you're in crisis, please call our hotline: 8010 5050
contact.formPlaceholder: Tell us how we can help...
contact.option1Desc: Join peer support groups where you can connect with others going through similar experiences.
contact.option2Desc: Learn more about mental health, warning signs, and coping strategies through our resource library.
contact.option3Desc: Access guided meditations, breathing exercises, and wellness resources at any time.
contact.option4Desc: Schedule appointments with licensed psychologists and therapists for ongoing support.
contact.option5Desc: Work with our team to develop a personalized safety plan for difficult moments.
contact.option6Desc: Connect with local mental health services and community support organizations.
contact.legal1Desc: This website does not replace emergency medical services. If you or someone you know is in immediate danger, call 911 or go to the nearest emergency room.
contact.legal2Desc: All information shared with our counselors is confidential and protected by professional ethical standards and applicable laws. Exceptions apply only when immediate danger to yourself or others exists.
contact.legal3Desc: All our psychologists and counselors are licensed professionals adhering to strict ethical guidelines. However, online support is not suitable for everyone and may not be appropriate during severe crises.
contact.legal4Desc: We use industry-standard encryption and security measures to protect your personal information. For details, please see our Privacy Policy.
contact.faq1Question: What happens when I call the hotline?
contact.faq1Answer: A trained counselor will answer your call. They'll listen to what you're going through, provide immediate support, and help you access appropriate resources. You can choose to continue the conversation or arrange follow-up care.
contact.faq2Question: How long is the wait time to speak with someone?
contact.faq2Answer: We prioritize getting you connected as quickly as possible. Average wait time for the hotline is under 2 minutes. During peak times, it may be longer, but you'll be speaking with someone trained to help.
contact.faq3Answer: Yes. You don't need to provide your name or any identifying information to call our hotline. Your privacy is important to us. However, providing information may help us serve you better.
contact.faq4Question: Is the service available in Arabic?
contact.faq4Answer: Our team can provide support in both French and Arabic. Please let us know your preferred language when contacting us, and we'll connect you with a counselor who speaks it.
contact.faq5Question: Is there a cost for calling the hotline?
contact.faq5Answer: The hotline is completely free. All services are available at no cost to anyone in need of support. Cost should never be a barrier to getting help.
contact.finalMessage: Reaching out takes courage. Whether you're struggling, worried about someone you care about, or just need someone to talk to, we're here. No judgment, no shame – just compassionate support from people who care about your wellbeing.
contact.finalCta: You are not alone. Your life matters. Help is available.
